alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Lexington; Newberry; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fairfield, east central Newberry, north central Lexington and northwestern Richland Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ballentine, or 7 miles southeast of VC Summer Nuclear Station. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jenkinsville, Chapin, Little Mountain, Pomaria, Peak, White Rock and Melvin Park. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 85 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
